text: A person commits the offense of insurance fraud in the second degree if that person knowingly engages in conduct specified in § 22-3225.02 with the intent to defraud or to fraudulently obtain property of another and the value of the property which is sought to be obtained is $1,000 or more.

division.text: Criminal Law and Procedure and Prisoners.

chapter.text: Theft; Fraud; Stolen Property; Forgery; and Extortion.

heading.catch_text: Insurance fraud in the second degree.
